Package com.cyberfront.crdt

Class OperationTwoSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cyberfront.crdt.AbstractCRDT
      • com.cyberfront.crdt.OperationTwoSet
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LastWriteWins
    public abstract class OperationTwoSet
extends AbstractCRDT
    This is an abstract class which defines a Two Set CRDT. One set contains operations to use, called an ADD set, and the other contains a set of operations which must not be used, called a REMOVE set. Elements in the REMOVE set have precedence over those in the ADD set. That is, if an element is contained in the REMOVE set it will not be used if it is in the ADD set, regardless of when it was added to the ADD set.

      • getOpsSet

        public java.util.Collection<Operation> getOpsSet()
        This method returns the collection of elements in the ADD set after those in the REMOVE set have been removed.
        Returns:
        The operations which are active in this Two Set CRDT

      • clear

        public void clear()
        This method removes all elements in both the ADD and REMOVE sets, effectively reseting them to empty.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        This method determines the state of the CRDT. If both the ADD and REMOVE sets are empty, then this is empty. Alternatively if the ADD set is s subset of the REMOVE set, this will also result in this indicating that there are no operations, resulting in this being an empty set.
        Returns:
        True exactly when the set of active operations is empty

        Parameters:
        operations - List of operations to search for the given OperationType
        type - OperationType to search for in the given collection
        Returns:
        True exactly when there is an operation of the given OperationType in the collection of operations; false otherwise
